text: Thanks for the suggestions, I will try those.
oh this was universal? I thought it was related to our error handling. They didn’t actually ever retry though
Yes same here, some of our integrations messed up because the custom code didn't run.

When I created a workflow to "copy property value", it updated existing contacts but doesn't appear to be updating newly created contacts. Any idea why that may be?

The goal is to copy a company property value to a corresponding contact property. Again, it worked the first go-round but not for those contacts created after the workflow was published.

My triggers are:
• Company is associated to: any contact
• Associated contacts has all of: [internal property] is unknown
Is there something more I need to add so it remains active for all contacts that come in?
<@U7BEP5R7T> some workflows wouldn’t even start so they weren’t even error handling

Hello Everyone,I have custom code action that will need to be placed in almost 100 workflows,  First, what are the best approaches to keep the custom code action separated outside the workflows and just calling it from workflows, I know you can call workflow from another workflow, is this the only approach? Second, can I pass in a parameter value to this custom code action. Thanks in advanced for your help!

Hi all, I’m wondering if anyone has come across any good examples or repositories for the Python/ HubSpot API wrapper? It seems pretty new and the provided documentation is somewhat sparse. I’m trying to find out how to get custom properties from the `crm.tickets.get_all()` method. 

Right now I’ve got some custom `requests` clients making the calls but it seems like this should be possible through the new wrapper.

Hi all, has anyone used a custom code action to make a request to Google maps/directions API to get the distance between 2 points. For example, in the UK if you have 2 postcodes then what is the distance in miles.
if you do a trigger that is “known” then every time it changes it will trigger

you can pass in variables when setting up the custom code. 

please explain to me why you need to put it in 100 workflows and be detailed a bit so we can help figure out how to best approach this
anytime i’m looking for examples of api code i tend to put some of that code or a url or something related into a gist search on github
yes. workflow you make sure you have some address variables, then send your api request.
Is there any sample custom code or a workflow screenshot that showed how this is achieved? I have the address properties available already

The custom code action calls Microsoft Dynamics web APIs and add campaign member, we need to do this in multiple workflows , and based on some conditions in the workflows. we also have to pass in campaign id.

is this possible? create property group for ms dynamics. add the some fields or one field and pass a json string to that field in your 100 workflows. 

then create a workflow that triggers on that property update. parse the json string and do your call, then clear the property after successful api call in that workflow
you would need to get that from the google api documentation or search github/gists etc. also chat gpt is an option
